REF command to ACT or REF command time

Specifies the number of DFI PHY clock cycles between when a write command is sent on the DFI control interface and when the dfi_wrdata_en signal is asserted.
DDR3: WL-1

Specifies the number of DFI PHY clock cycles from the assertion of a read command on the DFI to the assertion of the dfi_rddata_en signal
DDR3: RL-1
MRS leveling enable to load pulse
Delay settling time. Specifies the minimum number of DFI clock cycles from when the delays are loaded on the DTI_*_DLY signal to when the DTI_*_LOAD signal may be asserted.

DLL delay. Specifies the minimum number of DFI clock cycles from when DTI_*_LOAD signal updates the DLL delay in the appropriate DTI_*_DLY to when the PHY is ready for the next read or mode register read command.
Leveling response latency. Specifies the maximum number of DFI clock cycles from the assertion of a read or mode register read command to the guaranteed validity of the response signal.
DLL lock timeout. The number of DTI_CLOCKs from when the DLL reset is de-asserted to when the DLL is locked and ready for use
Leveling exit time, specifies the minimum number of DFI clock cycles after the de-assertion of the DTI_*LVL_EN signal to the MRS command to disable DDR training.
Number of DLL steps corresponding to hold time interval
Count-to value of retention counter (Width = RETENTION_WIDTH)
6 bits - Version, 5 bits - Reversion, 5 bits - Release
2 bits register denotes Max. BL. 2'b10 - 4, 2'b11 - 8, 2'b01 - BC4/BL8 OTF. Others - Reserved
2 bits register denotes DFI frequency ratio system: 2'b00 - Matching Frequency, 2'b01 - 1:2, 2'b10 - 1:4, 2'b11 - Reserved
Global Control FSM Error Interrupt Status
BIST Error status of DQ Data Range [31:0]
New BIST error in diagnosis mode
Failed rank address in diagnosis mode (Width = DRAM_RANK_WIDTH)
Failed bank address in diagnosis mode (Width = DRAM_BANK_WIDTH)
Failed row address in diagnosis mode  (Width = DRAM_ROW_WIDTH)
Gate training error. One bit for each data slice. 1 means gate training is not completed successfully.
Write leveling error. One bit for each data slice. 1 means write leveling is not completed successfully.
Write/Read sanity check error. One bit for each data slice. 1 means read pattern and write pattern for corresponding data slice are not matched. (2 ranks x 4 slices)
DLL reset error. Dllerr[1:0] is for data module [1:0]. 1 means the DLL reset process of corresponding module is not completed successfully.

Register Description: DLL  Status Register for PHY Command Module
Field Description: Overflow status. This output is set when a quarter of the clock cycle is greater than the largest delay that the delay chain can handle.
Underflow status. This output is set when a quarter of the clock cycle is less than the shortest delay that the delay chain can handle.

Register Description: DLL  Status Register for PHY Data Module
Field Description: Overflow status. This output is set when a quarter of the clock cycle is greater than the largest delay that the delay chain can handle.
Overflow status. This output is set when a quarter of the clock cycle is greater than the largest delay that the delay chain can handle.
Underflow status. This output is set when a quarter of the clock cycle is less than the shortest delay that the delay chain can handle.
